ralgorithm

Class Algorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • ralgorithm.Algorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Combing, CombToLine, Melt

    public abstract class Algorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for algorithms involving reconfiguration of Robot Objects.

    Designed in to be parallelizable in steps. An algorithm can have a number of functional steps for each reconfiguration. For example a "slide" step is broken up into a bunch of machine processable steps.

    Since:
    2/14/2016

    • Method Detail

      • isComplete

        public abstract boolean isComplete()
        Determines if the algorithm has finished executing
        Returns:
        a boolean value True is algorithm is done

      • determinePMove

        public ParallelMove determinePMove()
        Determines the next sequence of moves to be run in parallel

        Abstract method to be defined in instance of algorithm that is the essential step for the execution of the algorithm.

        If the method is initilly called in this class then it will be an error, because in an algorithm implementation we want to determine what the pmove is.

        Returns:
        ParallelMove which will be next run in the algorithm

      • determineNextStates

        public java.util.List<State> determineNextStates()
        Determines the next n states of the robot in the algorithm

        Often used so that some algorithms can contain other algorithms and determine next states through those lagorithms

        Default method just calls an implementations determinePMove and runs it.

        Returns:
        A list of robot states to render next

      • run

        public java.util.List<State> run()
        Runs the algorithm by running all of the Parallel Moves
        Returns:
        A List of Robot States that describe each step of the alg

      • reverse

        public static java.util.List<State> reverse(java.util.List<State> states)
        Reverses a list of robot states
        Parameters:
        states - A list of robot states to reverse

      • runReverse

        public java.util.List<State> runReverse()
        Runs the algorithm and reverses the states
        Returns:
        a reverse list of states produced by running the algorithm
